issues.description: The problem statement refers to the main class as 'Lecture' in the text descriptions and tasks, but the embedded UML diagram incorrectly labels it as 'Course'. This discrepancy could confuse students by implying that the class represents a different concept, making it difficult to map the requirements from the text to the diagram and subsequently to the template and solution code.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the UML diagram in the problem statement to use 'Lecture' as the class name instead of 'Course' to ensure consistent naming across all artifacts and reduce cognitive confusion for students.
